text: Radawczyk is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Niedrzwica Duża, within Lublin County, Lublin Voivodeship, in eastern Poland. It lies approximately north of Niedrzwica Duża and south-west of the regional capital Lublin. Radawczyk used to have a large German population. There was a church of baptists ("kapela"), later transformed into a depot; it burnt down in 2001. The Ciemięnga river flows through the village. The name of the village is related to two older nearby villages (Radawiec Mały and Radawiec Duży). ==References== Category:Villages in Lublin County
title: Radawczyk
